questions.question: I am going to ask her ………………. to dinner tonight.
questions.description: To ask somebody out is to invite them on a date.

questions.question: I won’t be able to get out before you back …………….. your car.
questions.description: To back up a car is to reverse it.

questions.question: My family didn’t back me ………………… over my decision to quit my job.
questions.description: To back somebody up is to support them.

questions.question: The car blew ……………… after it crashed into the tree.
questions.description: To blow up is to explode.

questions.question: Can you blow this balloon ……………..?
questions.description: To blow up a balloon is to inflate it.

questions.question: The car broke ...................... in the storm.
questions.description: When things break down they stop functioning.

questions.question: The woman broke …………………. when she learned that she had cancer.
questions.description: To break down is to cry.

questions.question: If you find the task difficult, break it …………….. into smaller parts.
questions.description: To break something down is to divide it into smaller parts.

questions.question: The thieves broke ……………… through the back door.
questions.description: To break in is to enter a building forcibly.

questions.question: Susie has called ……………. her wedding.
questions.description: To call off wedding is to cancel it.

questions.question: I desperately need someone to cheer me ……………..
questions.description: To cheer somebody up is to make them happy.

questions.question: I came ……………… these old letters while organizing the closet.
questions.description: To come across something is to find it by chance.
